texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["Motorcycles need to meet minimum emission standards when travelling within the Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) or be subject to a charge."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Vehicles included are:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Motorcycles","Mopeds","Motorised tricycles","Quadricycles (L category)"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Minimum emission standards"}
All vehicles need to meet Euro 3 emissions standards for NOx.
The ULEZ is enforced based on the declared emissions of the vehicle rather than the age - but generally speaking Euro 3 engines as those registered with the DVLA after July 2007.

Check your vehicle to see if it meets the standards. If the checker says your vehicle is subject to ULEZ but you think it does meet the standards, follow the steps on the results page to send us proof.
{"template":"start-row","link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"end-row","link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Contact your vehicle's manufacturer if you're not sure about its emissions - we will accept supporting evidence from them.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Motorbike emissions testing"}
We will also accept evidence from test facilities approved by us for measuring NOx emissions. If successful, the test facility will contact us with the results.
Test centres that believe they can offer motorcycle emissions testing to the required standards should email their contact details to ruculezenquiries@tfl.gov.uk .

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Charges (if ULEZ standards not met)"}
We would prefer vehicle owners to use vehicles that meet the new emissions standards rather than pay a daily charge.
A daily charge runs from midnight to midnight. If you drive within the ULEZ area across two days, for example before midnight and after midnight, you will have to pay two daily charges.
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Daily ULEZ charge: £12.50","Penalty charge: £160 (reduced to £80 if paid within 14 days)"]}
These are in addition to any Congestion Charges that may apply to some motorbikes. (Motorcycles etc are not subject to the Low Emission Zone (LEZ).)

Motorbikes and mopeds that do not meet the ULEZ emissions standards but are registered for a Congestion Charge residents' discount are entitled to a 100% discount from the ULEZ charge until 24 October 2021. Motorbikes and mopeds are exempt from both the Congestion Charge and T-Charge but you can still apply for a residents' discount. To register for the Residents' discount visit the Congestion Charge discounts and exemptions page .

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Nearly all motorcycles produced since 2007 meet the ULEZ standards","Check your vehicle registration document to find your vehicle's Euro emission standard or NOx emissions. If these are not listed on the vehicle registration document then check with the original manufacturer or use \u003ca href=\"/modes/driving/check-your-vehicle-35896\"\u003eour vehicle checker\u003c/a\u003e "]}
The date when your vehicle was first registered with the DVLA is in section B of the document. You can check the date with Gov.uk's vehicle enquiry service .
In February 2019 the Mayor of London announced additional funding to help low income vehicle Londoners upgrade to cleaner vehicles.

{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Questions about ULEZ?"}
If you need more advice about the ULEZ, you can make an enquiry .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"ULEZ boundary expansion"}
From October 2021 the ULEZ will expand to the North and South Circular Roads . All motorcycles within the expanded zone will need to meet the ULEZ emissions standards or pay a daily charge.
